description:
A critical security flaw has been discovered in the popular Next.js framework, potentially impacting millions of websites and applications. Security researchers Rachid Allam, known online as zhero, and Yasser Allam (inzo_) collaborated to uncover the flaw within the framework’s middleware functionality. Next.js, boasting over 130,000 stars on GitHub and nearly 10 million weekly downloads, is... Read more »

The post Critical security flaw uncovered in Next.js framework appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: Critical security flaw uncovered in Next.js framework
